body:
Help!

Y’ALL. I’m trying to pull the last few bits of a 10th Doctor costume that I’ve had forever together, and I need a wig. A short brown wig that I (or a friend that I trust more than myself) can potentially style to look the way I’d like.


Anyone have any suggestions?? I’m trying to get this done by Halloween. Any clues would be appreciated!!!!

blog.description: Hey. I'm Eva and sometimes I draw David Tennant. 28. Russia. Welcome all.

tags: he is really like a drug
title: DT on the FACTS
body:
With your permission, I will write here about FACTS Comic Con in Belgium. I love to read stories about how peaple met David, so I know how cool it is when someone write about it.This story is not unusual, but still I am pleased to recall about that day.
So,
We were lucky to meet him three times on that day. To say we were worried is to say nothing. We were excited so much and we had to rehearse everything we did for not to disgrace ourselves at the moments of the meet, so much moral strength for looking good, but everything was going not by the plan anyway :D

The first time: Autographs.
We were one of the first to go, thanks to the VIP-badge. Moreover, I did not buy an autograph, but the organizers allowed me to stand in a queue to give him a present. What kind of people! When the moment came, it seems I was covered with three-layer goosebumps and forgot all the words .. He sat at that table and very nicely communicated with everyone. And not even repeated in his chats.
Dark brown jumper, from under it was a white monkey-T-shirt (one of my favorites!). Not a man, but a walking PaulSmith, as usual. :D He had a very cool hairstyle (which by the evening was already wrinkled, but in the morning his hair looked really great). And with his disheveled mane and knitted jumper with a zipper, he still was so refined and elegant… with his huge eyes and the visible warmth that emanated from his smile, he looked everyone in the eye and generously distributed handshakes. When the line came to me, I said that I did not need an autograph and I just wanted to give him a small souvenir. He smiled, made a surprised face, looked inside the paperbag and said “Oh, great! New portion of beautiful socks, thaaank you!” and reached out to shake my hand. His palms are warm and strong, by the way. We exchanged a couple more phrases and I walked way with the mutual “See you later”. I was walking squeezing my hand tightly, and stopping to close my eyes or face.  … David is like a cure-module in a game - the moment that instantly makes up for all your lost XP.

The second time: A photo.
We were first in line, missed forward only two people in wheelchairs. Everything happened faster than I could have imagined. So fast that I didn’t have time to realize what happened and remember it. Before that, I was not going to hug him with both hands, it seemed to me it is not very acceptable. But when my turn came, he spread his arms with his “Hiiii!”, grabed me in the hugs and I automatically hugged him too, while forgetting to open my eyes to the end. XD As a result, I got some kind of drunk photo)) Damn!) XD He smells freshness, and his sweater is really soft, and it is slightly cold, as if just it’s from the outdoors.
Honestly, I still don’t believe he hugged me. Only due to this “drunk” photo I can believe in the reality of what was happening.

The third time: The Q&A Panel.
We arrived in advance, but we still could not sit closer than on the third row. Some of our friends are more fortunate :) But it was still pretty close. He ran to the stage under stormy ovations, pointed to his huge portrait in the role of the Doctor. And he showed with gestures like “Is it really me? It seems, I got bigger!” XD Then he greeted everyone, but the microphone did not work, and he had to wait until they brought another one. You have already seen the panel yourself, or you can see it here: https://vk.com/video-64483458_456240549 (credit to DAVID TENNANT ASYLUM)
This is the merit of my friend Maria, before whom I bow for the endurance of her hands. I intercepted her phone for about seven minutes, and during that time my hands almost fallen off.
Unfortunately, we we could not ask anything, although we had a lot of questions. We were preparing for it a lot but we were unlucky XD… But there were many of people who did it.Thank you very much, David, for coming there, thanks for the handshakes, for the hugs, for the shining, warmth and openness to all the fans, I missed you so much, but now, damn it, I miss you much more.

summary: The day we’ve all been dreading has finally happened. David Tennant has finally fucked up -- and guys, it’s bad. I’m really...
body:
The day we’ve all been dreading has finally happened. David Tennant has finally fucked up – and guys, it’s bad.

I’m really shocked I haven’t seen more people spreading this.

I don’t know how we’re going to move on from this association between something so terrible and something we hold so dear, but you can hope that an apology will follow.

I don’t know how we’re going to move on from this association between something so terrible and something we hold so dear, but you can hope that an apology will follow.

summary: Neil Gaiman: Pratchett wanted to watch Good Omens ‘before the lights go out’ - Evening Express
title: Neil Gaiman: Pratchett wanted to watch Good Omens ‘before the lights go out’ - Evening Express
excerpt: Author Neil Gaiman has said he viewed turning the book he co-authored with Sir Terry Pratchett into a TV series as a “last request” from the Discworld creator before he died.

blog.name: michaelsheen
blog.title: michaelsheen
blog.description:
Brittany. 22.
Stannis Baratheon loyalist. 
Masters of Sex, Mad Men, A Song of Ice and Fire, and a shitload of other tv shows, movies, video games, history and the occasional old man. 
Michael Sheen is the supreme bae. 
Christoph Waltz and John Slattery get an honorable mention. 
Bobby Kennedy deserved better.

tags: shit you already know what i'm going to say
i KNOW it's stupid because it's a natural reaction for an actor to have
(or anyone who has done multiple jobs for that matter)
but michael is clearly more passionate about good omens than he was about MoS
and I daresay he is more collaborative with and complimentary of david tennant
like overall he seems to think of good omens as more of a team effort (and talks about it accordingly)
he treats david more as a partner than simply a coworker
(and i'm whining about it in a purely professional context - not even a romantic one)
maybe he feels more comfortable by being this complimentary because david is another guy
i'm still looking forward to watching good omens
